alert.note: Alert for Coke; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Coke and southwestern Nolan Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 614 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Sanco, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area and Sanco. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
